intro: Siphocampylus pulchellus, commonly known as the beautiful siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
